page.description: Returns the class of the object.

item.name: Browses (for <OBJECT> use either the <BROWSE> pointer or the name of the browse)
Form Controls (for <OBJECT> use the <CONTROL> pointer or the address of the control)

section.description: The <OBJECT>.CLASS() method returns the class (i.e., type) of the object.

section.title: Example
section.description: Assume a form called F1 has a field called City and a button called Button1.
The following example returns the class of a table field.
section.example: dim ptr as P dim tptr as P dim fptr as P ptr = form.load("Customer Information") ptr.show() tptr = Table.current() fptr = tptr.field_get(2) ? fptr.class() = "Field"

section.description: The following example returns the class of a form field named lastname.
section.example: dim ptr as P ptr = form.load("Customer Information") ptr.show() ? ptr.lastname.class() = "type-in field"
